org.apache.gora.mongodb.utils

Class BSONDecorator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.gora.mongodb.utils.BSONDecorator

  • public class BSONDecorator
extends Object
    Utility class to build DBObject used by MongoDB in an easy way by directly specifying the fully qualified names of fields.
    Author:
    Fabien Poulard

    • Constructor Summary

    • Method Detail

      • asDBObject

        public com.mongodb.DBObject asDBObject()
        Access the decorated BSONObject.
        Returns:
        the decorated DBObject in its actual state

      • containsField

        public boolean containsField(String fieldName)
        Check if the field passed in parameter exists or not. The field is passed as a fully qualified name that is the path to the field from the root of the document (for example: "field1" or "parent.child.field2").
        Parameters:
        fieldName - fully qualified name of the field
        Returns:
        true if the field and all its parents exists in the decorated DBObject, false otherwise

      • getDBObject

        public com.mongodb.BasicDBObject getDBObject(String fieldName)
        Access field as a BasicDBObject.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - fully qualified name of the field to be accessed
        Returns:
        value of the field as a BasicDBObject

      • getDBList

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • put

        public void put(String fieldName,
       Object value)
        Set field. Create the intermediate levels if necessary as BasicDBObject fields.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - fully qualified name of the field to be accessed
        value - value of the field
